title: Azure Cognitive Search
descriptionMarkdown: Azure Cognitive Search is a cloud search service that gives developers infrastructure, APIs, and tools for building a rich search experience over private, heterogeneous content in web, mobile, and enterprise applications. This connector lets you stream your Azure Cognitive Search diagnostics logs into Microsoft Sentinel, allowing you to continuously monitor activity.

sampleQueries.query:
AzureDiagnostics 
| where ResourceProvider == "MICROSOFT.SEARCH" 
| summarize count() by Resource

value:
AzureDiagnostics | where ResourceProvider == "MICROSOFT.SEARCH"
 | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
 | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(7d)

dataTypes.name: AzureDiagnostics (Cognitive Search)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery: AzureDiagnostics| where ResourceProvider == "MICROSOFT.SEARCH" | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated) | where isnotempty(Time)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

customs.name: Policy
customs.description: owner role assigned for each policy assignment scope

instructionSteps.title: Connect your Azure Cognitive Search diagnostics logs into Sentinel.
instructionSteps.description: This connector uses Azure Policy to apply a single Azure Cognitive Search log-streaming configuration to a collection of instances, defined as a scope. Follow the instructions below to create and apply a policy to all current and future instances. Note, you may already have an active policy for this resource type.

instructionSteps.title: Stream diagnostics logs from your Azure Cognitive Search at scale

innerSteps.title: Launch the Azure Policy Assignment wizard and follow the steps.
innerSteps.description:
> 1. In the **Basics** tab, click the button with the three dots under **Scope** to select your subscription.
2. In the **Parameters** tab, choose your Microsoft Sentinel workspace from the **Log Analytics workspace** drop-down list, and leave marked as "True" all the log categories you want to ingest.
3. To apply the policy on your existing resources, mark the **Create a remediation task** check box in the **Remediation** tab.
